intro: Oxalis reichei, commonly known as the rainbow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, intricate foliage and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, with heart-shaped leaves and clusters of five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Oxalis reichei is also noted for its ability to bloom throughout the growing season, adding continuous color to gardens.
